definitions.definition: (Bangladesh) A class of rich high-caste (Brahmin) landlords in Bengal formed during the British Raj.
Half-melted snow or ice.
Liquid mud or mire.
Flavored shaved ice served as a drink.
A soft mixture of grease and other materials, used for lubrication.
The refuse grease and fat collected in cooking, especially on shipboard.
A mixture of white lead and lime, used as a paint to prevent oxidation.
Unsolicited manuscripts, as in slush pile.
To smear with slushy liquid or grease.
To slosh or splash; to move as, or through, a slushy or liquid substance.
To paint with a mixture of white lead and lime.
Any climbing vine of the genus Dioscorea in the Eastern and Western hemispheres, usually cultivated.
The edible, starchy, tuberous root of that plant, a tropical staple food.
A sweet potato; a tuber from the species Ipomoea batatas.
Potato.
A oca; a tuber from the species Oxalis tuberosa.
Taro.
An orange-brown colour, like the flesh of the yam.
(Cumberland) home
A large knife designed for cutting cooked turkey and similar dishes.
A knife used to pare, cut, and smooth wood.
Any of various luxury forms of camping.
A composite work, particularly an artwork, created by assembling or putting together other elements such as pieces of music, pictures, texts, videos, etc.
The art or process of doing this.
To combine into, or depict as, a montage.
A member of the obsolete taxonomic order Pachydermata, grouping of thick-skinned, hoofed animals such as the rhinoceros, hippopotamus, elephant, pig and horse.
An elephant
A person with thick skin; someone who is not affected by or does not care what others say about him or her.
Someone who is insensitive.
A sudden thought, particularly one that solves a long-standing problem.
definitions.example: I had been working on the problem for weeks, and then I had a brainstorm and saw that the solution was easy.

definitions.definition: A session of brainstorming, investigating a problem to try to find solutions.
An unexpected mental error.
To investigate something, or solve a problem using brainstorming.
To participate in a brainstorming session.
The act, practice, or occupation of supervising and taking care of young children.
A place where young children are supervised while away from their parents or guardians.
A person who writes the lyrics of a song.
A concave surface or curve.
The vault of the sky.
One of the celestial spheres of the Ptolemaic or geocentric model of the world.
definitions.example: Aristotle makes [Fire] to move to the concave of the Moon. - Thomas Salusbury (1661).

definitions.definition: An element of a curved grid used to separate desirable material from tailings or chaff in mining and harvesting.
An indentation running along the base of a surfboard, intended to increase lift.
An indented area on the top of a skateboard, providing a position for foot placement and increasing board strength.
To render concave, or increase the degree of concavity.
Curved like the inner surface of a sphere or bowl
(of a polygon) not convex; having at least one internal angle greater than 180 degrees.
(of a real-valued function on the reals) satisfying the property that all segments connecting two points on the function's graph lie below the function.
Hollow; empty
One of the aristocracy, nobility, or people of rank in a community; one of a ruling class; a noble (originally in Revolutionary France).
A proponent of aristocracy; an advocate of aristocratic government.
To display for others to see, especially in regard to wearing clothing while performing the role of a fashion model
definitions.example: She modelled the shoes for her friends to see.

definitions.definition: To use as an object in the creation of a forecast or model
definitions.example: They modelled the data with a computer to analyze the experiment’s results.

definitions.definition: To make a miniature model of
definitions.example: He takes great pride in his skill at modeling airplanes.

definitions.definition: To create from a substance such as clay
definitions.example: The sculptor modelled the clay into the form of a dolphin.

definitions.definition: To make a model or models
To be a model of any kind
definitions.example: The actress used to model before being discovered by Hollywood.

definitions.definition: The art of sculpting models from clay etc. to create a representation of something.
The representation of depth in a two-dimensional image.
The profession of someone who models clothes.
The construction and use of a computer model of a physical system.
The learning of a new skill by copying other people.
A metal.
Any of several types of plant.
Wrongly, erroneously
definitions.example: I mistakenly assumed that the shop was still there.

definitions.definition: By accident, by mistake, in error (without intention to do so)
definitions.example: Today I mistakenly took your packed lunch to work.

definitions.definition: A hole drilled or milled through something, or (by extension) its diameter.
definitions.example: the bore of a cannon

definitions.definition: The tunnel inside of a gun's barrel through which the bullet travels when fired, or (by extension) its diameter.
A tool, such as an auger, for making a hole by boring.
A capped well drilled to tap artesian water. The place where the well exists.
One who inspires boredom or lack of interest; an uninteresting person.
Something dull or uninteresting
Calibre; importance.
To inspire boredom in somebody.
To make a hole through something.
To make a hole with, or as if with, a boring instrument; to cut a circular hole by the rotary motion of a tool.
definitions.example: An insect bores into a tree.

definitions.definition: To form or enlarge (something) by means of a boring instrument or apparatus.
definitions.example: to bore a steam cylinder or a gun barrel; to bore a hole

definitions.definition: To make (a passage) by laborious effort, as in boring; to force a narrow and difficult passage through.
definitions.example: to bore one's way through a crowd

definitions.definition: To be pierced or penetrated by an instrument that cuts as it turns.
definitions.example: This timber does not bore well.

definitions.definition: To push forward in a certain direction with laborious effort.
(of a horse) To shoot out the nose or toss it in the air.
To fool; to trick.
A sudden and rapid flow of tide occuring in certain rivers and estuaries which rolls up as a wave.
To carry or convey, literally or figuratively.
definitions.example: Judging from the look on his face, he wasn't bearing good news.

definitions.definition: To support, sustain, or endure.
To support, keep up, or maintain.
To press or impinge upon.
To produce, yield, give birth to.
(originally nautical) To be, or head, in a specific direction or azimuth (from somewhere).
definitions.example: By my readings, we're bearing due south, so we should turn about ten degrees east.

definitions.definition: To gain or win.
To physically swirl or rotate.
To rotate.
To pass around, go around the side of.
To go to another person's home.
To be sufficient, be enough for everyone.
A herding dog of a breed originating near the border between England and Scotland, and specifically bred for intelligence and obedience.
An energetic trot, slower than a run, often used as a form of exercise.
A sudden push or nudge.
A flat placed perpendicularly to break up a flat surface.
To push slightly; to move or shake with a push or jerk, as to gain the attention of; to jolt.
definitions.example: jog one's elbow

definitions.definition: To shake, stir or rouse.
definitions.example: I tried desperately to jog my memory.

definitions.definition: To walk or ride forward with a jolting pace; to move at a heavy pace, trudge; to move on or along.
(exercise) To move at a pace between walking and running, to run at a leisurely pace.
To cause to move at an energetic trot.
definitions.example: to jog a horse

definitions.definition: To straighten stacks of paper by lightly tapping against a flat surface.
Excessive pride, presumption or arrogance (originally toward the gods).
A North American rattlesnake, Crotalus cerastes, that inhabits lowland deserts.
A person who is untrustworthy and dangerous.
A heavy swinging blow from the side which disables an adversary.
A pitcher who throws sidearm.
A type of middle-distance deep-sea trawler widely used during the 1960s and 1970s.
Any inedible or poisonous mushroom, especially an agaric.
A sheet of copper or steel used in the construction of a boiler.
The rating plate or nameplate required to be affixed to a boiler by the (UK) Boiler Explosions Act (1882).
A plate attached to industrial machinery, identifying information such as manufacturer, model number, serial number, and power requirements.
Syndicated material.
Standard text or program code used routinely and added with a text editor or word processor; text of a legal or official nature added to documents or labels.
definitions.example: They put that boilerplate on all the warning labels.

definitions.definition: Hard, icy snow which may be dangerous to ski on.
To store (standard text) so that it can easily be retrieved for reuse.
Describing text or other material of a standard or routine nature.
definitions.example: The contract contained all the usual boilerplate clauses.

definitions.definition: Used to refer to a non-functional spacecraft used to test configuration and procedures.
definitions.example: A boilerplate spacecraft was used to test the rocket

definitions.definition: A thin skin membrane that covers and moves over an eye.
An enemy.
Not friendly; hostile; mean.
Unfavourable.
In an unkind or unfriendly manner; not as a friend
With a red face; flushed, due to emotional or physical causes.
The act of salvaging or in some manner restoring a discarded item to yield something usable.
The act of using again, or in another place.
definitions.example: Code reuse can save programmers a lot of typing.

definitions.definition: To use again something that is considered past its usefulness (usually for something else).
definitions.example: The students reused empty plastic bottles in their science experiment.

definitions.definition: To use again, or in another place.

Any of several large herbivorous pachyderms native to Africa and Asia of the five extant species in the three extant genera in the family Rhinocerotidae, with thick, gray skin and one or two horns on their snouts.
Long, flat ribbons of pasta, originally from Emilia-Romagna, sliced from a rolled-out sheet
A member of a mob or Mafia
Any of many kinds of birds, of the families Muscicapidae (in Europe and Asia) and Tyrannidae (in the Americas), that catch insects in flight.
The act of dispossessing someone of something.
The casting out of an evil spirit that has possessed someone; exorcism.
A tall residential or office building.
A traffic circle.
(chiefly with initial capital) Any of the clubs making up the international Rotary International movement for community service.
Capable of rotation.
definitions.example: A rotary engine revolves the heads rather than having pistons go back and forth.

definitions.definition: Physically strong and active.
Mentally strong and active.
Rapid of growth.
definitions.example: a vigorous shrub

definitions.definition: To bury in a grave.
To confine, as in a prison.
Gloomy, mournful or dismal, especially to an exaggerated degree.
definitions.example: His client’s lugubrious expression tipped off the detective that something lurked beneath her optimistic words.

definitions.definition: Rain which is unusually acidic (pH of less than the natural range of 5 to 6); caused mainly by atmospheric pollution with sulphur dioxide and nitrogen compounds.
An extra tyre carried in case one of the vehicle's tyres is damaged or deflated.
A large paunch and rolls of fat around the waist.
(sometimes New York) Any cod, pollock, haddock, or other whitefish.
To shred.
A baby’s bed with high, often slatted, often moveable sides, suitable for a child who has outgrown a cradle or bassinet.
A bed for a child older than a baby.
A small sleeping berth in a packet ship or other small vessel
A wicker basket; compare Moses basket.
A manger, a feeding trough for animals elevated off the earth or floor, especially one for fodder such as hay.
The baby Jesus and the manger in a creche or nativity scene, consisting of statues of Mary, Joseph and various other characters such as the magi.
A bin for drying or storing grain, as with a corn crib.
A small room or covered structure, especially one of rough construction, used for storage or penning animals.
A confined space, as with a cage or office-cubicle
A job, a position; (British), an appointment.
A hovel, a roughly constructed building best suited to the shelter of animals but used for human habitation.
One’s residence, or where one normally hangs out. A house or dwelling place.

A boxy structure traditionally built of heavy wooden timbers, to support an existing structure from below, as with a mineshaft or a building being raised off its foundation in preparation for being moved; see cribbing.
(usually in the plural) A collection of quotes or references for use in speaking, for assembling a written document, or as an aid to a project of some sort; a crib sheet.
A minor theft, extortion or embezzlement, with or without criminal intent.
The card game cribbage.
The cards discarded by players and used by the dealer.
A known piece of information corresponding to a section of encrypted text, that is then used to work out the remaining sections.
A small holiday home, often near a beach and of simple construction.
A packed lunch taken to work.
A small raft made of timber.
(thieves' cant) The stomach.
A cheat sheet or past test used by students; crib sheet.
To place or confine in a crib.
To shut up or confine in a narrow habitation; to cage; to cramp.
To collect one or more passages and/or references for use in a speech, written document or as an aid for some task; to create a crib sheet.
definitions.example: I cribbed the recipe from the Food Network site, but made a few changes of my own.

definitions.definition: To plagiarize; to copy; to cheat.
To install timber supports, as with cribbing.
To steal or embezzle, to cheat out of.
(Indian English) To complain, to grumble
To crowd together, or to be confined, as if in a crib or in narrow accommodations.
(of a horse) To seize the manger or other solid object with the teeth and draw in wind.
The state of being dissident; dissent
(newspapers) The department or staff responsible for reporting and editing local news.
(newspapers) The department or staff responsible for reporting and editing financial and business news.
Of or pertaining to high levels of activity; having many memorable events.
definitions.example: With the number of drunken revellers on the streets it could hardly fail to be an eventful night.

definitions.definition: A court order in the form of a warrant, authorizing the search of a home and/or other privacy-protected place(s), notably to seek unlawful possessions, evidence etc. as part of a judicial inquiry
definitions.example: Evidence found without a valid search warrant may be discarded by the courts as null and void

definitions.definition: To fill by packing or crowding something into; to cram with something; to load to excess.
definitions.example: I'm going to stuff this pillow with feathers.

definitions.definition: To fill a space with (something) in a compressed manner.
definitions.example: He stuffed his clothes into the closet and shut the door.

definitions.definition: To fill with seasoning.
definitions.example: She stuffed the turkey for Thanksgiving using her secret recipe.

definitions.definition: To load goods into (a container) for transport.
(used in the passive) To sate.
definitions.example: I’m stuffed after having eaten all that turkey, mashed potatoes and delicious stuffing.

definitions.definition: (pronominal) To eat, especially in a hearty or greedy manner.
definitions.example: She sits on the sofa all day, watching TV and stuffing herself with cream buns.

definitions.definition: To break; to destroy.
definitions.example: He skidded off the road and totally stuffed his brand new car.

definitions.definition: To sexually penetrate.
definitions.example: His wife came home early and found him on the couch stuffing the maid.

definitions.definition: (mildly vulgar, often imperative) Used to contemptuously dismiss or reject something. See also stuff it.
definitions.example: Stuff your stupid rules, I'll do what I like.

definitions.definition: To heavily defeat or get the better of.
definitions.example: Mudchester Rovers were stuffed 7-0 in the semi-final.

definitions.definition: To cut off another competitor in a race by disturbing his projected and committed racing line (trajectory) by an abrupt manoeuvre.
definitions.example: I got stuffed by that guy on the supermoto going into that turn, almost causing us to crash.

definitions.definition: To preserve a dead bird or other animal by filling its skin.
To obstruct, as any of the organs; to affect with some obstruction in the organs of sense or respiration.
To form or fashion by packing with the necessary material.
To crowd with facts; to cram the mind of; sometimes, to crowd or fill with false or idle tales or fancies.
To compress (a file or files) in the StuffIt format, to be unstuffed later.
The matter used to stuff hollow objects such as pillows and saddles.
Any of many food items used to stuff another.
definitions.example: stuffing for a Christmas turkey

definitions.definition: A mixture of oil and tallow used in softening and dressing leather.
The insertion of many copies of a word into a web page in an attempt to increase its search engine ranking.
A tax loophole whereby a corporation acquires property that will result in a loss of revenue, purely in order to reduce its tax liability.
Of or pertaining to a congregation
That reacts or responds to a stimulus
That readily takes part in reactions
definitions.example: francium is the most reactive of the alkali metals.

definitions.definition: Characterized by induction or capacitance rather than resistance.
Reacting to the past rather than anticipating the future, not predictive.
A room with pool tables where pool can be played, usually for a fee.
A plant-eating aquatic marine mammal, of the genus Dugong, found in tropical regions.
A high-explosive bomb used for the purposes of demolishing extensive areas, such as a city block.
Something, such as a film or book, that sustains exceptional and widespread popularity and achieves enormous sales, as opposed to a box office bomb.
Anything very large or powerful; a whopper.
A large firework of the firecracker type; an M-80.
One who engages in blockbusting (technique encouraging people to sell property).
The elements of an image which lie closest to the picture plane.
The subject of an image, often depicted at the bottom in a two-dimensional work.
The application the user is currently interacting with; the application window that appears in front of all others.
To place in the foreground (physically or metaphorically).
A stagehand
A lively dance, popular in 16th- and 17th-century Europe.
The triple-time music for this dance.
A brisk, merry person.
An intermediate size of type alternatively equated with brevier (by Didot points) or bourgeois (by Fournier points and by size).
Gay; brisk; active.

A branch of science that studies the society and human behavior in it, including anthropology, communication studies, criminology, economics, geography, history, political science, psychology, social studies, and sociology.
A solid of revolution generated by rotating an ellipse about its major (prolate), or minor (oblate) axis.
definitions.example: UFOs are reported as being either oblate (saucer-shaped) or prolate (cigar-shaped) spheroids.

definitions.definition: Of a shape similar to a squashed sphere.
To unload goods from an aircraft or ship.
To disembark.
To remove the bark from a tree, especially one that has been felled.
To devocalize (a dog).
An idler, a lout.
A boy, a lad.
A harlot; mistress.
A simpleton.
A crazy or deranged person.
An English soldier of an expeditionary army in Ireland.
Any of various birds, of the order Gaviiformes, of North America and Europe that dive for fish and have a short tail, webbed feet and a yodeling cry.

A breed of dog developed in England by the crossing of the bullbaiting dog and the Pug to produce a ladies companion dog. Having a very smooth coat, a flattened face, wrinkly cheeks, powerful front legs and smaller hind legs.
British bulldog
A stubborn person.
A refractory material used as a furnace lining, obtained by calcining the cinder or slag from the puddling furnace of a rolling mill.
(Oxford University slang) One of the proctors' officers.
(pro wrestling) Any move in which the wrestler grabs an opponent's head and jumps forward, so that the wrestler lands, often in a sitting position, and drives the opponent's face into the mat.
A bulldog edition.
To chase (a steer) on horseback and wrestle it to the ground by twisting its horns (as a rodeo performance).
Something produced each hour.
definitions.example: She never reads her hourly report, but let her hourlies be fifteen minutes late and she raises a ruckus.

definitions.definition: Occurring every hour.
definitions.example: There are hourly express buses.

definitions.definition: Unsalaried, paid by the hour; (by extension) blue-collar.
At intervals of an hour.
definitions.example: Express buses depart hourly.

definitions.definition: An outside door with glass panes, serving as a window and a door
A particular subdivision of ancient Laconia.
A form of folk magic, medicine or witchcraft originating in Africa and practised in parts of the Caribbean.
A magician or witch doctor of the magic craft.
A spell performed in the practice of the magic craft; an item associated with such a spell.
Having the quality of a declamation.
Pretentiously lofty in style; bombastic.
A spoon made from wood, commonly used in food preparation.
An ironic prize for finishing last in a competition.
(Cambridge University slang) The last junior optime who takes a university degree.

(college slang) The lowest appointee of the junior year; sometimes, one especially popular in his class, without reference to scholarship. Formerly, it was a custom for classmates to present to this person a wooden spoon with formal ceremonies.

(travel) A travel service with a train timed to arrive at a ferry port in time for the onward travel by ferry (or vice versa). Alternatively, a service scheduled to connect with the arrival or departure of an ocean liner.
A man who plows land with a plough.
definitions.example: A cereal breeder's farmhands must be good plowmen.

definitions.definition: Useful in predicting.
definitions.example: The amount of rain in April is predictive of the number of mosquitoes in May.

definitions.definition: Describing a predictor.
Expressing the expected accuracy of a statistical measure or of a diagnostic test.
A person who straggles, or departs from the direct or proper course, or from the company to which they belong.
One who falls behind the rest, for example in a race.
One who roams without any settled direction.
A migratory animal found away from its usual range.
A roving vagabond.
Something that shoots, or spreads out, beyond the rest, or too far; an exuberant growth.
Something that stands alone or by itself.
A man who works in a dairy.
A man who delivers dairy products.
An argument or debate characterized by the loudness or intensity of the participants.
Abhorrence, a sense of loathing, intense aversion, repugnance, repulsion, horror.
A sudden violent feeling of disgust.
The treatment of one diseased area by acting elsewhere; counterirritation.
A strong pulling or drawing back; withdrawal.
A sudden reaction; a sudden and complete change of the feelings.
A solid figure with many flat faces and straight edges.
A polyscope, or multiplying glass.
A sudden strong rise or flow.
To surge up, or to become stronger or greater
Ornamental domesticated varieties of the common carp (Cyprinus carpio), of Japan and eastern Asia with red-gold or white coloring.
Inclined or having a propensity to love, or to sexual enjoyment.
definitions.example: We were both feeling amorous so the inevitable happened.

definitions.definition: Indicating love or sexual desire.
definitions.example: She kept making these amorous suggestions.

definitions.definition: Of or relating to, or produced by, love.
definitions.example: She read me an amorous poem.

definitions.definition: Affected with love; in love; enamored.
definitions.example: He had been amorous of her since schooldays.

definitions.definition: A polygon with five sides and five angles.
A fort with five bastions.
Unable to be bridged or crossed; impossible to span.
One who is zealous, one who is full of zeal for his own specific beliefs or objectives, usually in the negative sense of being too passionate; a fanatic

A member of a radical, warlike, ardently patriotic group of Jews in Judea, particularly prominent in the first century, who advocated the violent overthrow of Roman rule and vigorously resisted the efforts of the Romans and their supporters to convert the Jews.
A member of an anti-aristocratic political group in Thessalonica from 1342 until 1350.
Careful, prudent, cautious.
definitions.example: The politician gave a canny response to the reporter's questions.

definitions.definition: Knowing, shrewd, astute.
definitions.example: The canny lawyer knew just how to get what he wanted.

definitions.definition: Frugal, thrifty.
definitions.example: canny investments

definitions.definition: Pleasant, fair, favorable or agreeable to deal with.
definitions.example: She's a canny lass hor like!

definitions.definition: Gentle, quiet, steady.
definitions.example: a canny horse

definitions.definition: Very, considerably; quite, rather.
definitions.example: That's a canny big horse, man!

definitions.definition: Gently, quietly; carefully, skilfully.
definitions.example: drive canny

definitions.definition: (especially of sound) Sounding as if it is coming through a tin can.
The fruit forbidden to Adam.
Illicit pleasure.
Something desired that cannot be had.
definitions.example: She was forbidden fruit because she's his teacher. This taboo made him want her even more

definitions.definition: A small variety of shaddock (Citrus maxima), or sometimes other citrus fruits.
An X-ray image of the blood vessels gained after the injection of a radiopaque contrast medium.
Unreasonably stubborn.
definitions.example: John was so bullheaded that he kept driving and refused to stop for directions, even after getting hopelessly lost.

definitions.definition: The claw of a predatory animal or bird.
(by extension) A grip, especially one seen as rapacious or evil.
A device to interrupt power transmission, commonly used to separate the engine and gearbox in a car.
The pedal in a car that disengages power and torque transmission from the engine (through the drivetrain) to the drive wheels.
Any device for gripping an object, as at the end of a chain or tackle.
A small handbag or purse with no straps or handle.
To seize, as though with claws.
definitions.example: to clutch power

definitions.definition: To grip or grasp tightly.
definitions.example: She clutched her purse tightly and walked nervously into the building.

definitions.definition: A brood of chickens or a sitting of eggs.
A group or bunch (of people or things).
To hatch.
An important or critical situation.
Performing or tending to perform well in difficult, high-pressure situations.
